SEARCH
Package com.minesweeper.model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
com.minesweeper.model.Game
public class Game extends Object
The Game class represents the Minesweeper game logic. It manages the game grid, handles user interactions, and tracks the game state.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a new Game with the specified game mode.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(GameMode mode)
      Constructs a new Game with the specified game mode. Initializes the game grid and places mines based on the difficulty level.
      Parameters:
      mode - The game mode which determines the difficulty level. It can be one of the following:
      • EASY: 9x9 grid with 10 mines
      • MEDIUM: 16x16 grid with 40 mines
      • HARD: 16x30 grid with 99 mines

  • Method Details

    • getNumMines

      public int getNumMines()
      Returns the number of mines in the game.
      Returns:
      the number of mines.

    • initGame

      public void initGame(int rows, int columns)
      Initializes the game grid with the specified number of rows and columns.
      Parameters:
      rows - The number of rows in the game grid.
      columns - The number of columns in the game grid.

    • placeMines

      public void placeMines(int numMines)
      Places the specified number of mines randomly on the game grid.
      Parameters:
      numMines - The number of mines to be placed.

    • setCounts

      public void setCounts()
      Sets the count of adjacent mines for each non-mine cell in the game grid.

    • revealCell

      public void revealCell(Cell cell)
      Reveals the specified cell. If the cell contains a mine, the game is marked as over. Otherwise, it reveals all adjacent cells.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell to be revealed.

    • revealAll

      public void revealAll(Cell cell)
      Reveals all cells adjacent to the specified cell. If the cell has a neighbor with no adjacent mines, it recursively reveals all of its neighbors.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell to be revealed.

    • getNeighbors

      public List<Cell> getNeighbors(Cell cell)
      Gets the neighbors of the specified cell.
      Parameters:
      cell - The cell to get neighbors for.
      Returns:
      A list of neighboring cells.

    • getAdjacentMines

      public int getAdjacentMines(int row, int col)
      Returns the number of adjacent mines for the cell at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      Returns:
      the number of adjacent mines.

    • getRows

      public int getRows()
      Returns the number of rows in the game grid.
      Returns:
      the number of rows.

    • getColumns

      public int getColumns()
      Returns the number of columns in the game grid.
      Returns:
      the number of columns.

    • GameOver

      public boolean GameOver()
      Checks if the game is over.
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise.

    • getCell

      public Cell getCell(int row, int col)
      Gets the cell at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index of the cell.
      col - The column index of the cell.
      Returns:
      the cell at the specified row and column.

    • getGrid

      public Cell[][] getGrid()
      Gets the game grid.
      Returns:
      The game grid.

    • getNewlyRevealedCells

      public List<Cell> getNewlyRevealedCells()
      Gets the list of newly revealed cells.
      Returns:
      The list of newly revealed cells.

    • isWon

      public boolean isWon()
      Checks if the game is won. Game is won if all non-mine cells are revealed.
      Returns:
      true if the game is won, false otherwise.
